reviewText: Gangsters Paradise: Jerusalema does not present the people of Azania (South Africa) at their best but it does give insight into the way poverty promotes crime, and the way the Azania masses are still suffering from the effect of apartheid. Excellent movie, acting, production values and theme.
summary: Long Live the Heroic Azanian People In Their Struggle Against the Effect of Apartheid
Title: N/A

reviewText: Movie came faster than I expected! Clean disc played well. The movie starts off a little dry the first 15 minutes, but after that it kept my interest the whole time! It is a must-see it's great!! Reminds me of a american movie. Interesting to see how they do it in South Africa love it!

reviewText: Although fictional, this movie gave me an insight into the lives of ordinary urban South Africans. The movie was well produced.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Learned alot from this movie. If anyone wants to know how other countries and people survive, this will do it for South Africa. Leaders and followers and others that take advantage of the situations. Could find no fault in any of the cases.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Pretty cool how the dude comes from rags to riches by helping out ghetto inhabitants by establishing a trust and withholding everyones rent from the landlords until the building goes into foreclosure, then he buys it and charges the tenants a lower rate so they all love him.Resorts to shooting and violence only when drugs and criminals threaten his neighborhoods, good movie but wouldn't watch it over and over.

reviewText: A brilliant work of post-apartheid South Africa as young clever boy made it up socially by robbery and murdering less lucky contestants.
